title: NumPyTutorial

metadata.description: Learn about NumPyTutorial with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Learn NumPy
[+:
NumPy is a Python library.
NumPy is used for working with arrays.
NumPy is short for "Numerical Python".
Learning by Reading
We have created 43 tutorial pages for you to learn more about NumPy.
Starting with a basic introduction and ends up with creating and plotting random data sets, and working with NumPy functions:
Basic
Introduction
Getting Started
Creating Arrays
Array Indexing
Array Slicing
Data Types
Copy vs View
Array Shape
Array Reshape
Array Iterating
Array Join
Array Split
Array Search
Array Sort
Array Filter
Random
Random Intro
Data Distribution
Random Permutation
Seaborn Module
Normal Dist.
Binomial Dist.
Poisson Dist.
Uniform Dist.
Logistic Dist.
Multinomial Dist.
Exponential Dis.
Chi Square Dist.
Rayleigh Dist.
Pareto Dist.
Zipf Dist.
ufunc
ufunc Intro
Create Function
Simple Arithmetic
Rounding Decimals
Logs
Summations
Products
Differences
Finding LCM
Finding GCD
Trigonometric
Hyperbolic
Set Operations
Learning by Examples
In our "
Example
Create a NumPy array:
import numpy as np
arr = np.array([1, 2, 3, 4, 5])
print(arr)
print(type(arr))

Click on the "
Learning by Exercises
Many chapters in this tutorial end with an exercise where you can check your level of knowledge.
See all NumPy Exercises
Learning by Quiz Test
Test your NumPy skills with a quiz test.
Start NumPy Quiz

content_sections.title: Example
content_sections.code:
import numpy as np
arr = np.array([1, 2, 3, 4, 5])
print(arr)
print(type(arr))

practice_exercises.title: Complete the Code 1
practice_exercises.description: Fill in the missing line to make this code work.
practice_exercises.starter_code:
import numpy as np
# TODO: Complete this line
print(arr)
print(type(arr))
practice_exercises.solution:
import numpy as np
arr = np.array([1, 2, 3, 4, 5])
print(arr)
print(type(arr))

practice_exercises.title: Implement a Function
practice_exercises.description: Create a function that demonstrates the concepts from this tutorial.

quiz.question: What is NumPy?
quiz.explanation: The correct definition of NumPy is 'a Python library'.

quiz.question: What is NumPy?
quiz.explanation: The correct definition of NumPy is 'used for working with arrays'.

summary: This tutorial covers NumPyTutorial concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use NumPyTutorial effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of NumPyTutorial and how to apply it in your projects.
